comments.body: I use blocks and failure conditions to do cleanup, is that a better approach here? Minor differences but I'd think this could muddy up a real environment.

I always clean the environment at the start of a run (for all dependencies of the tests). But you'd normally run this on test equipment. Sure you can use blocks, but IMO they may make things more complex and may remove the environment required to troubleshoot what is going on.

So I am not a big fan of doing this myself.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +10,14 @@

# CLEAN ENVIRONMENT
- name: Remove label ansible_test2
  msc_label: &label_absent
